column4: Guys: I am hoping someone can help me with wireless issue here.
I was running wireless fantastic on my feisty box... but when i upgrade to ubuntustudio by adding the repos.. it broke my wireless and now i don't know how to enable it
iwconfig wlan0 essid linksys key *********** mode managed this was my command to connect to wireless using wlan0 and now it says it doesn't exist
Error for wireless request "Set ESSID" (8B1A) :  SET failed on device wlan0 ; No such device
what does iwconfig say
output: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/26378/
i never had the vmnet1 and vmnet8 before... ubutustudio broke my wirelss with their hacked kernel
what is ubuntustudio
i thought it was ubuntu+multimedia package + look
http://www.ubuntustudio.org/
one can add ubuntustudio repos to source.list and add ubuntustudio to desktop that way, which is how i did it, but it broke my wireless in the process
does it modify the kernel?
precisely
well, that is the problem then
lol, i know but can it be fixed?
hm ... well i dunno if there is an easy way
get the kernel sources, recompile it with your wifi-drivers and there you go
i don't mind as long as there is a way...
lol...yea, right..... i can just about switch a computer on dude
hm too bad ^^
then send a bug report @ubuntustudio or so
is this a regular thing everyone can do... recompile kernels with wifi drivers???
